Whom amongst you engaged in sin this part Christmas?
 
 Gluttony...
 Sloth...
 Greed...
 Envy...
 Wrathfulness...
 Vanity...
 Pride...
 Any number of sexual perversions...
 Hypocracy...
 
 Come on, it just wouldn't be a Christian holiday without engaging in some of those.
 
 Me, I probably engaged in pride and a form of wrathfulness as I showered many close family members with gifts even though they refuse to speak to me and treat me like dirt nearly any time of the year and didn't get me anything (They're Christians). 
 And, in most cases, they really enjoyed what I got them.
 
 I was a little slothful in putting up decorations though. My son didn't seem to care and was just happy to get a boat load of stuff (including a pet Boa that he sacrifices mice to) so a tree bought at the last minute (normally, I just steal them off the lot...but had to pay this year as they seem to be in high demand now) and tossed on some home made decorations from last year.
 
 The things I did get though were actually well thought out. Normally, I get some superficial, last minute thoughtless gift.
 
 I think next year, I'll publish a book revealing all the deep-dark family secrets that I've sat on for the better part of 14 years and mail copies to all of the family and their church members and neighbors. 
 Oh the hilarity that would ensue.
 
 Hey, beats a shooting rampage.
 
 But, I'll probably just buy them more gifts for them to choke on. 
 
 So, any excitement and sin on your day of merriment?

 That's all I had...and the tree I bought was beutiful. 
 2 years ago a co-habitant had a Victorian style tree covered with period piece collectable ornaments. Every square inch was covered.
 Not my style really. Took her hours to decorate.
 She managed to smuggle it in behind my back...I wouldn't normally allow such a thing in 'my house'.
 
 And, while grocery shopping tonight with the son, I tried to explain to him why some people have trouble losing weight. Women who've just had kids, people who's metabolism has changed...
 Fortunatly, foods not one of my indulgences. Lack of a sense of smell I think.
